PermissibleValues.value: Anti-leukemic or tumor agent to treat relapse
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Antileukemic Agent Or Antineoplastic Agent Treat Recurrent Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Antileukemic Agent Or Antineoplastic Agent Treat Recurrent Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any substance that treats, prevents, or inhibits the development of leukemia.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A substance that inhibits the maturation, growth or spread of tumor cells.: Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: Any substance that treats, prevents, or inhibits the development of leukemia.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A substance that inhibits the maturation, growth or spread of tumor cells.
Subject to a process with the aim of readying for some purpose, improving, or remedying a condition.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

PermissibleValues.value: Intervention for decline in cell count
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intervention or Procedure Reduced Cell Count

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Reduced Cell Count
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: Made less in size or amount or degree.: A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample. Also used to mean the result of such a procedure.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Made less in size or amount or degree.
A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any substance that treats, prevents, or inhibits the development of leukemia.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A substance that inhibits the maturation, growth or spread of tumor cells.: Used to prevent disease.: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: Any substance that treats, prevents, or inhibits the development of leukemia.

PermissibleValues.value: Intervention for delay in cell count recovery
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intervention or Procedure Delay Cell Count Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Delay Cell Count Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.: Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.: A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample. Also used to mean the result of such a procedure.: A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.
A procedure to determine the number of cells in a sample.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Therapeutic Procedure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Therapeutic Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
